alert.note: Alert for Blue Earth; Faribault (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 23 at 5:50PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Faribault and eastern Blue Earth Counties through 615 PM CDT... At 549 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Delavan, or 22 miles south of Mankato, moving north at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Mapleton around 600 PM CDT. Good Thunder around 605 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include St. Clair, Mankato, Eagle Lake and Madison Lake. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 between mile markers 117 and 135. U.S. Highway 14 between mile markers 131 and 143. U.S. Highway 169 between mile markers 1 and 17, and between mile markers 50 and 55. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for south central Minnesota.
